com.defano.jmonet.tools.builder

Class PaintToolBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.defano.jmonet.tools.builder.PaintToolBuilder

  • public class PaintToolBuilder
extends Object
    A utility for building paint tools.

    • Method Summary

      Specifies whether the tool should draw a single shape, or a trace of multiple shapes as the mouse is dragged.

      • withEraseColor

        public PaintToolBuilder withEraseColor(Color paint)
        Specifies the color that pixels are changed to when they're erased (via the eraser or pencil tools). Specify null for fully-transparent (default behavior).

        Note that this value does not affect the color of "void" pixels that are left behind when selecting a region and moving or deleting it. Further note that the default boundary behavior associated with FillTool looks for fully transparent pixels to be filled, thus, when changing the erase color to a non-null value, erased pixels will not be filled by this tool (install a custom BoundaryFunction using withBoundaryFunction(BoundaryFunction) if such behavior is desired).

        Parameters:
        paint - The color that erased pixels should become; null means fully transparent.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withEraseColorObservable

        public PaintToolBuilder withEraseColorObservable(io.reactivex.Observable<Optional<Color>> erasePaintObservable)
        Specifies an observable provider of the paint that pixels are changed to when they're erased (via the eraser or pencil tools). Specify Optional.empty() for fully-transparent (the default behavior).

        Note that this value does not affect the color of "void" pixels that are left behind when selecting a region and moving or deleting it. Further note that the default boundary behavior associated with FillTool looks for fully transparent pixels to be filled, thus, when changing the erase color to a non-null value, erased pixels will not be filled by this tool (install a custom BoundaryFunction using withBoundaryFunction(BoundaryFunction) if such behavior is desired).

        Parameters:
        erasePaintObservable - Observable providing the color that erased pixels should become; null means fully transparent.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withIntensity

        public PaintToolBuilder withIntensity(double intensity)
        Specifies the intensity with which the airbrush paints. Has no effect on other tools.
        Parameters:
        intensity - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 where 0 is no intensity (tool produces no paint) and 1.0 is full intensity.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withIntensityObservable

        public PaintToolBuilder withIntensityObservable(io.reactivex.Observable<Double> intensityObservable)
        Specifies an observable provider of the intensity with which the airbrush paints. See withIntensity(double).
        Parameters:
        intensityObservable - A value between 0.0 and 1.0 where 0 is no intensity (tool produces no paint) and 1.0 is full intensity.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withDrawCenteredObservable

        public PaintToolBuilder withDrawCenteredObservable(io.reactivex.Observable<Boolean> drawCenteredObservable)
        Specifies an observable provider of a boolean value indicating whether the tool defines bounds by dragging from the center-out, or from top-left to bottom-right. Affects tools extending BoundsTool.
        Parameters:
        drawCenteredObservable - True to define bounds from the center-out; false for top-left to bottom-right
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withPathInterpolationObservable

        public PaintToolBuilder withPathInterpolationObservable(io.reactivex.Observable<Boolean> observable)
        Specifies an observable indicating whether the airbrush's path interpolation is enabled. When enabled, the airbrush will paint a smooth series of single-pixel "stamps" rather than a line between captured mouse points. Enabled by default; has no effect on other tools.
        Parameters:
        observable - The path interpolation observable
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder.

      • withPathInterpolation

        public PaintToolBuilder withPathInterpolation(boolean enabled)
        Specifies whether the airbrush's path interpolation is enabled. When enabled, the airbrush will paint a smooth series of single-pixel "stamps" rather than a line between captured mouse points. Enabled by default; has no effect on other tools.
        Parameters:
        enabled - When true, path interpolation will be used.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder.

      • withConstrainedAngleObservable

        public PaintToolBuilder withConstrainedAngleObservable(io.reactivex.Observable<Integer> observable)
        Specifies an observable providing the constrained angle (in degrees) to use with this tool. The constrained angle is used to snap drawn shapes and selections (like lines, polygons and rotations) to the nearest multiple of this value when the shift key is held down.
        Parameters:
        observable - The constrained angle, in degrees.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder

      • withConstrainedAngle

        public PaintToolBuilder withConstrainedAngle(int angle)
        Specifies the constrained angle (in degrees) to use with this tool. The constrained angle is used to snap drawn shapes and selections (like lines, polygons and rotations) to the nearest multiple of this value when the shift key is held down.
        Parameters:
        angle - The constrained angle, in degrees.
        Returns:
        The PaintToolBuilder
